avalancheActivity.comment:
As the precipitation becomes more intense medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large dry and wet avalanches are to be expected. In particular on wind-loaded slopes dry avalanches can be triggered in the new snow and wind slab layers.
The fresh snow and the wind slabs that are forming especially adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls can be released by a single winter sport participant.
Over a wide area rain to intermediate altitudes. Gradual increase in danger of moist and wet avalanches as the snowfall level rises.
Ski touring and other off-piste activities, including snowshoe hiking, call for experience in the assessment of avalanche danger.
avalancheActivity.highlights: As a consequence of snowfall the snowpack could not consolidate.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Over a wide area over a wide area 15 to 30 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, will fall above approximately 2200 m. The moderate wind will transport the new snow and, in some cases, old snow as well.
In some cases the wind slabs have bonded poorly with each other and the old snowpack. This applies especially in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain.

avalancheActivity.comment:
As the snowfall becomes more intense the avalanche prone locations will become more prevalent in the afternoon. The fresh snow and the wind slabs that are forming in particular above approximately 2300 m will become increasingly prone to triggering. Medium-sized to large natural avalanches are possible in particular on very steep slopes.
New snow and wind slabs can be released, even by a single winter sport participant.
Over a wide area rain to intermediate altitudes. Gradual increase in danger of moist and wet avalanches as the snowfall level rises.
Ski touring and other off-piste activities, including snowshoe hiking, call for experience in the assessment of avalanche danger.
avalancheActivity.highlights: In the afternoon in particular at intermediate and high altitudes there will be an increase in the avalanche danger to level 3 (considerable).

snowpackStructure.comment:
Over a wide area over a wide area 20 to 30 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, will fall above approximately 2200 m. The moderate wind will transport the new snow and, in some cases, old snow as well.
In some cases the wind slabs have bonded poorly with each other and the old snowpack.
Above approximately 2200 m a lot of snow is lying.

tendency.comment: In the evening as the snowfall becomes more intense there will be an increase in the danger.

avalancheActivity.comment:
As the precipitation becomes more intense small and, in isolated cases, medium-sized dry and wet avalanches are to be expected.
The fresh snow and the wind slabs that are forming especially adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls can be released by a single winter sport participant.
Over a wide area rain to intermediate altitudes. Gradual increase in danger of moist and wet avalanches as the snowfall level rises.
Ski touring and other off-piste activities, including snowshoe hiking, call for experience in the assessment of avalanche danger.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Above approximately 2000 m snow will fall over a wide area. New snow and wet snow represent the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Over a wide area over a wide area 15 to 30 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, will fall above approximately 2200 m.
The moderate wind will transport the new snow and, in some cases, old snow as well. In some cases the wind slabs have bonded poorly with each other and the old snowpack.
In particular at intermediate and high altitudes there is still a very large amount of snow.

tendency.comment: The avalanche danger will increase during the day.
